message: django-pipeline it's fork of django-compress and I don't like that I need to mention static files needed to be compressed in settings.py. I prefer\using django-compressor by jezdez

really mention static files is not elegant way, but, what about the performance with generate content inside of the request/response loop (used by django-compressor),  even compression is disabled, a minimal comprobation is required.
To my understanding, django-compressor caches the resulting files, leading to minimum overhead after the first request.
